alert.note: Alert for Furnas; Harlan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued February 10 at 2:34PM CST until February 11 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Possible Friday Afternoon... .Strong northwest winds behind a cold front combined with a dry airmass could promote critical fire weather conditions across parts of the local area Friday afternoon. The most prone areas will be along and south of a line extending from Arapahoe Nebraska to Beloit Kansas. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FRIDAY AFTERNOON FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 005, 006, 017, 018, 019, 082 AND 083... The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect Friday afternoon. * AFFECTED AREA...In Kansas, Fire Weather Zone 005 Phillips, Fire Weather Zone 006 Smith, Fire Weather Zone 017 Rooks, Fire Weather Zone 018 Osborne and Fire Weather Zone 019 Mitchell. In Nebraska, Fire Weather Zone 082 Furnas and Fire Weather Zone 083 Harlan. * WINDS...Northwest 25 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * TIMING...The most critical conditions are anticipated Friday afternoon. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 20 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that ignite may spread rapidly and exhibit extreme fire behavior. Use extreme caution if engaging in activities that could lead to fire ignition.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
